author: Tay Yong Kwang J:
casename: City Developments Ltd v Estate of Syed Allowee bin Ally Aljunied, deceased
counsel: Kenneth Pereira and Rajaram Muralli Raja (Allen & Gledhill LLP) for the plaintiff; Leslie Netto and Bevin Netto (Netto & Magin LLC) for the interested parties; Syed Noah Aljunied in person
tags-parsed: Land/Adverse possession/Physical possession/Intention to possess/Categories of adverse possession claims/Plot of unregistered land/Developer bought land which enclosed plot/Whether developer, through predecessors of land, was entitled to plot by adverse possession/Whether 12-year period necessary to establish title by adverse possession could be constituted by aggregate of separate but continuous periods of adverse possession by different people/Whether adverse possessor had to know he was trespassing on another's land/Section 177(3) Land Titles Act 1993 (Act 27 of 1993) and s 9 Limitation Act (Cap 163, 1996 Rev Ed)
